articles.title: England 27-10 Argentina: George Ford kicks 14-man England to superb Rugby World Cup victory
articles.description: George Ford kicks 27 points to steer England to a magnificent World Cup win over Argentina after Tom Curry's first-half red card.
articles.content:
Tom Curry became the first England player to be sent off in a World Cup match

articles.title: George Ford boots 14-man England past Argentina in Marseilles
articles.description: Pumas had no answer to England’s defensive discipline and Ford’s kicking excellence
articles.content:
England’s George Ford kicks his first drop goal during the Rugby World Cup Pool D match against Argentina in Marseille. Photograph: James Crombie/Inpho
England 27 Argentina 10
It matters little how or where England unearthed a performance of this ilk... [5974 chars]

articles.title: Rugby-Fantastic Ford kicks 14-man England to win over Argentina
articles.description: Ford, starting in the place of the suspended Owen Farrell, scored all the points, including a record-equalling three drop goals in a 10-minute first-half blitz that seemed to sap Argentina's spirit. England were unrecognisable from the team who had lost six of their nine games under coach Steve Borthwick, showing pace and invention in attack and fierce determination in defence.
articles.content: Flyhalf George Ford kicked England to a remarkable 27-10 World Cup victory over Argentina on Saturday in a performance full of intensity and tactical guile and all the more astonishing as they played with 14 men from the third minute. Ford, starting ... [3342 chars]

articles.title: England 27-10 Argentina: George Ford leads 14 men to dominant World Cup win after Tom Curry sees red
articles.description: Steve Borthwick’s spirited and resilient side deliver a muscular Marseille masterclass to get up and running in Pool D
articles.content:
G eorge Ford took 14-man England back to the nineties with an old-school, drop-goal barrage to seize Rugby World Cup lift-off with a 27-10 victory over Argentina in Marseille.
Fly-half Ford booted all of England’s points and piloted his team so well ... [4635 chars]

articles.title: Ford kicks England past Argentina in World Cup opener
articles.description: George Ford kicked all the points, including three drop-goals, to help 14-man England cast off a dismal run of form to claim a comprehensive 27-10 victory over Argentina in the teams’ Pool D World Cup opener on Saturday.
articles.content:
George Ford kicked all the points, including three drop-goals, to help 14-man England cast off a dismal run of form to claim a comprehensive 27-10 victory over Argentina in the teams’ Pool D World Cup opener on Saturday.

articles.title: Ford kicks 14-man England to relieving win over Argentina at Rugby World Cup
articles.description: MARSEILLE, France (AP) — George Ford kicked everything, including three first-half drop goals, to give 14-man England a pressure-relieving 27-10 win over Argentina at the Rugby World Cup on Saturday.
articles.content:
